summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Ad Hoc Committee on Legislative Affairs of the City of Dallas will convene on May 7, 2024, at 9:00 AM in the Council Chambers, 6th Floor of City Hall. The meeting will be accessible both in-person and via videoconference, aimed at discussing legislative priorities and related matters.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the December 11, 2023, meeting.
2. Consideration of the 2025 Federal Legislative Priorities, including an overview of the process for establishing these priorities.

**Important Details**:  
The committee will receive a briefing from the Office of Government Affairs, led by Carrie Rogers and her team, on the proposed federal legislative priorities for 2025. This discussion is crucial for aligning the city’s legislative agenda with federal initiatives and funding opportunities.

**Action Items**:  
The committee is seeking approval of the December meeting minutes and will deliberate on the 2025 Federal Legislative Priorities. Decisions made during this meeting will guide the city’s legislative strategy moving forward. 

The meeting will also include provisions for a closed executive session if discussions pertain to sensitive legal or financial matters, ensuring compliance with Texas Open Meetings Act regulations.
